text: Hello,  Do you know how I will can config servername or serveralias?
I need config a loadbalancer
but these options are the Apache server, Is there something similar in HubSpot?

<@U6XDD2SAW>
HubSpot handles all of it for you, as far as I’m aware there are no such config options to configure with HubSpot.

If you would like more information on this I would suggest contacting HubSpot support as they likely can provide more information on their set up and explain how they handle the issues load balancers exist to solve.
Thank you <@U7SL518D6> , I had contact with support, but support tell me that is better that I will contact with the developer community

Hey <@U6XDD2SAW> assuming this is your community post <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Load-Balancer/m-p/276312#M25170> it looks like what you are for is a reverse proxy. This is something that we don’t support.  When people have tried it, it generally ends up looking like DOS attack to our WAF and we do not whitelist IPs of proxies.  Not to mention it negates the benefits of the CDN that we provide.  If you want a HubSpot hosted site, it will have to be a on a subdomain.
<@UFBNA9K9A>, thank you for your response, I will tell my provider

are file uploads hidden by default from search engine crawls?
like pdfs?
I think I asked that a long time ago, and was told basically - if I need hubfs files to be hidden for sure I should add an entry to the robots.txt to hide them
Correct, if they are linked to at all on a page, they will be indexed

There is a plus to it not being the default - since obviously if you have a relevant image or something like that to a search result you could benefit from the traffic.

PDFs especially if tied to thank you pages totally understandable to want to hide them
awesome.  thanks!
totally makes sense
I’m also not as familiar with the sales side but - I think the sales tools have a file upload tool that lets you track hits to files and stuff, and those files I think are by default not indexed.
Theoretically you could link to those files for thank you pages
be nice if there was a boolean for indexing  :slightly_smiling_face:
one less step for the marketing team to do
that’d be handy. Especially if there was a way to do it at the folder level in the file manager
<@UFBNA9K9A>, well, is there no way for config external load balancer?
My provider tell me that he call HubSpot with subdomain

<@U6XDD2SAW> So HubSpot (as Jon mentioned above) already provides all the load balancing you should need through a combination of the CDN and our own load balancing behind that as well.  If you just want to connect your subdomain to HubSpot, this the best link <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/connect-a-domain-to-HubSpot>
Of course, but users will see the subdomain in their browsers and not the main domain, right?
Yes, they will
<@UFBNA9K9A>, sorry, one question more, Can we change the ssl certification? for example to put it with wildcart (*.<http://domain.com|domain.com>), thank you so much!
Yes, you can <https://www.HubSpot.com/products/marketing/ssl> That service allows you to support wildcard (or even Extended Validation) on your cert with HubSpot
thank you <@UFBNA9K9A>
No problem, let me know if anything else comes up
Hey <@U26B530N6> thanks. I just want to know how I can implement the new site search into my blog and have it only search the blog, returning search results on the blog itself, ideally.
I want to understand how I can use the modules in a custom template and what attributes I'm able to impact through hubl
